title: Rewriting the Log with Exponentiation
text: Since we know that $$25=5^2$$, we can replace $$25$$ with $$5^2$$ in the log such that we now have $$\log_{3}\left(5^2\right)$$. You may notice tthat this allows us to simplify with the power rule.
speech: Since we know that  25 is equal to 5 squared , we can replace  25  with  5 squared  in the log such that we now have , the log base 3 of, parentheses 5 squared  . You may notice tthat this allows us to simplify with the power rule.

title: Using the Power Rule to Simplify
text: We can use the power rule as follows. We know that the exponent that $$\log_{b}\left(M^n\right)=n\log_{b}\left(M\right)$$. In this case, $$M=5$$ and $$n=2$$. This means that $$\log_{3}\left(5^2\right)=2\log_{3}\left(5\right)$$
speech: We can use the power rule as follows. We know that the exponent that  the log base b of, parentheses   m to the n-th,  is equal to n the log base b of   m . In this case,    m is equal to 5  and  n, is equal to 2 . This means that , the log base 3 of, parentheses 5 squared  is equal to, 2 the log base 3 of 5
